text: [Music]
spring is one of the most popular times
of the year to visit Japan with visitors
from all over the globe flocking to
experience the enchanting beauty of
Japan's iconic cherry blossoms or Sakura
there are countless spots nationwide to
view the blossoms so to make planning
your perfect petal field trip a little
easier here's a countdown of our top ten
socrata spots in Japan number 10
Miyajima a short ferry ride across the
water from the city of Hiroshima is the
island of miyajima famous for its
Kashima shrine the large floating gate
dear inhabited hills and charming
shopping streets to the delight of
visitors each spring the island becomes
beautifully decorated by cherry blossoms
making miyajima even more picturesque
than normal and well worth a visit
during sakura season number nine go to
ikkaku fort this unique western-style
Citadel in Hokkaido has hundreds of
trees planted along its fortifications
and moat that provide a flurry of pink
petals each springtime and be sure not
to miss the bird's eye view of this
hanami haven which can be enjoyed from
the adjacent goleo ikkaku tower number 8
Yoshino Yama
for centuries Yoshino yama has been
considered by many to be the most
spectacular hanami spot in all of Japan
with tens of thousands of cherry trees
spread out across a range of elevations
sakura can usually be enjoyed in Yoshino
yama from early through mid-april with
flowers higher up the mountain blooming
later than those at the base
number seven kikuno dante in springtime
the former samurai district in the town
of kikunoi becomes beautifully decorated
by weeping cherry trees on top of this
the hundreds of sakoda which line the
riverbanks are an ideal place to have a
picnic all-in-all kikuna a provides
visitors with a downright Pleasant
cherry blossom atmosphere that echoes of
centuries past number six
he made G Castle with its grand white
exterior he Meiji is widely considered
to be Japan's most spectacular castle
also designated as a World Heritage Site
- this national treasure can be
photographed with a beautiful socrata
frame around early April number five the
Fuji five Lakes region due to its higher
elevation the cherry blossoms in the
area just north of Mount Fuji called the
Fuji five lakes region usually bloom in
mid to late April which is a few weeks
later than nearby Tokyo and Yokohama in
the Fuji five lakes region two of the
most breathtaking places to view the
mountain and cherry blossoms together
are from the chudat oppa Goro and also
from the northern shores of lake
kawaguchiko number four Osaka the sheer
number of cherry trees make concise
largest metropolis Osaka a stellar
hanami destination which could easily be
placed even higher on the list depending
on personal preference one of the city's
primary hanami areas is the Riverside
chemische a code anomia park that
stretches from multiple kilometers and
connects to the equally cherry tree
abundant osaka castle park within the
castle grounds a particularly nice place
for a picnic is nishinomaru Park in the
castles western citadel which has wide
lawns views of the castle tower and also
light-up events in the evening finally
the walking paths and wide lawns of the
expo 70 commemorative park in northern
osaka boast an additional few thousand
trees for blossom chasers to enjoy and
also has illumination events at night
number three Kyoto
the ancient capital of Japan is where
cherry blossoms meet cultural heritage
with an array of the city's historical
buildings and gardens becoming awash
with pink and white each spring a few
specific spots to enjoy this aquata
season in Kyoto are the Philosopher's
path
Mariama Park which has night
illuminations and the hills of the
atashi AMA district in the West which
have an abundance of trees near the
tollgate skill bridge
Nakano Shima Park and along the main
shopping street number 2 Tokyo the
nation's capital is home to more hanami
spots than anywhere else in the country
boasting a large number of cherry trees
in a plethora of its parks Gardens city
streets and riverbanks Tokyo has an
ideal socrata spot to please everyone in
particular a few of the more noteworthy
locations are the sidewalks and river
scenes found in Chidori Kikuchi which
also lights up at night the extensive
scenic gardens in the family-friendly
Shinjuku Gyoen which by the way does not
allow alcohol inside the park and Buena
Park both along the central walking path
in the upper section of the park which
has more of a lively party hanami
atmosphere and also in the lower section
around shinobazu pond and finally number
one hirosaki castle this amazing Castle
Park in the northern prefecture of
Almaty feels like multiple outstanding
hanami spots all combined into one this
spring Wonderland has everything a
cherry blossom fan could wish for in
addition to the castle which is
surrounded by numerous varieties of
cherry trees there are food stands a
boating pond and the country's oldest
and broadest psalm a Yoshino variety of
cherry tree there's plenty of space to
picnic amongst the blossoms and the park
is often subject to Pleasant petal
blizzards that leave the castle moat
completely pink towards the end of the
season making hirosaki castle our number
one sakura location in the entire
country so there you have it our top ten
cherry blossom spots in Japan hopefully
this video helps you to plan your
perfect petal field trip more in-depth
information on the cherry blossoms can
be found in the dedicated section of our
website including this year's forecast
list of the best Sakura spots nationwide
tree varieties
and during soccer season daily cherry
blossom reports from around the country
for more information or to watch another
video click the links on the screen now
or head over to Japan guide calm your
comprehensive up to date Travel Guide
firsthand from Japan thanks for watching
and be sure to subscribe for more videos
about Japan happy travels
